message: What does this ruleset do ?
Tip: it might not do what it should do but does what it does very well.

hahahah !! Your modesty should be rewarded . I'll tell you the the secret functionality of this ruleset.

yes, removing the clown hats will make it work. removing a var declaration or removing the second rule will also make it work.

Reading bucket names from S3 now, but not happy with the performance.
Parse the XML on the browser, then send it all back to KNS as events, which send the names back to the browser for display.
@rsbohn Ouch! Awesome! In the sense that you have learn a lot from the exercise
just created a new group on facebook : iloveeatingkrlclownhats@groups.facebook.com
I foresee great success
I mean, it makes a good clock and all.
How about this: If I put two append() actions in one rule the whole ruleset fails. All I get is // KNS Sat May 21 ...
Occasionally I'll get a parse error before that.
Guess I'm a borderline case.
Be proud, the parse error is for first class citizen only.
@rsbhon In the case of your two appends, did you wrap them in {braces}? Multiple actions in a rule or in a defaction need to be wrapped in braces.
hmmm... may have been a red herring then. If you run into it again. I'd love some details so we can nail whatever the problem was.
If I comment out the 'append' action it starts working again.
I'm still not clear on what your problem is. To be fair, I havn't tried your code yet,
could you nail mine too :( ?
At the rate you guys are going, keeping track of your issues and filing bugs is going to be a full time job.
Yes I did -- can't dup today.
some more details about my ruleset. it is the result of a bigger ruleset that failed and in which i removed line after line because I was getting "// KNS Sat May 21" in the js
so it doesn't make sense but it will help you to identify the parsing problem
After many retries I get this from KNS
// 2011/05/23 10:49:33 ERROR Parser.pm a421x72 [global] Can't parse ruleset: line 58:31 no viable alternative at input '*'
On line 52? Same thing, KNS-as-clock.
loooooooooll told you ! we need a public bug reporting system

shouldn't be, so it sounds like an engine error.
